books.title: Short Science Fiction
books.author: Isaac Asimov
books.summary: A collection of short science fiction by Isaac Asimov, ordered by date of original publication.

books.title: The Survivors of the Chancellor
books.author: Jules Verne
books.summary: A record of the ill-fated voyage of the Chancellor as told by one of the passengers.

books.title: The Education of Henry Adams
books.author: Henry Adams
books.summary: A prominent and caustic historian reflects on the reasons that “the more he was educated, the less he understood,” and what he believes the future holds for American society.

books.title: A General History of the Pirates
books.author: Captain Charles Johnson
books.summary: The lives and stories of the daring pirate outlaws who terrorized the Atlantic Ocean and Caribbean Sea in the 18th century.

books.title: The Bungalow Mystery
books.author: Carolyn Keene
books.summary: A young amateur detective investigates a new friend’s abusive guardian.

books.title: The Merchant of Venice
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: To help his friend Bassanio woo the beautiful Portia, the Venetian merchant Antonio borrows a large sum from Shylock, a Jewish moneylender.

books.title: Fanny’s First Play
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: A young woman writes a play to shock her father, in which two respectable families deal with their with disreputable children.

books.title: Peter and Wendy
books.author: J. M. Barrie
books.summary: A mischievous and cocky young boy, Peter Pan, takes Wendy and her brothers on adventures on a fantasy island consisting of mermaids, pirates, Native Americans, and fairies.

books.title: The House Without Windows
books.author: Barbara Newhall Follett
books.summary: A young woman seeks a new home where she is not trapped by walls or windows.

books.title: Frankenstein
books.author: Mary Shelley
books.summary: A tragic scientist creates a monster in his laboratory.

books.title: The House of the Dead
books.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
books.summary: A ex-convict in 19th-century Russia reminisces on his experiences in a Siberian prison.

books.title: The Man in the Queue
books.author: Josephine Tey
books.summary: A police inspector is baffled by the case of a man who was stabbed while waiting in a theater queue.

books.title: Narrative of the Life of Frederick Douglass
books.author: Frederick Douglass
books.summary: Frederick Douglass describes his youth as a slave in Maryland and his desire to be a free man.

books.title: Culture and Anarchy
books.author: Matthew Arnold
books.summary: Matthew Arnold describes what he considers to be the flaws in Victorian British society.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A collection of poems by Oscar Wilde.

books.title: Point Counter Point
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.summary: Several connected stories are interwoven to create a satirical look at English society.

books.title: Beyond Thirty
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: A young naval officer finds himself in a forbidden part of the world after storms waylay his ship.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Nella Larsen
books.summary: A collection of Nella Larsen’s short fiction by date of publication.

books.title: Paradise Lost
books.author: John Milton
books.summary: A dramatic imagining in blank verse of the rebellion of Satan against God, Satan’s overthrow, and the Fall of Man.

books.title: Through the Brazilian Wilderness
books.author: Theodore Roosevelt
books.summary: Theodore Roosevelt’s autobiographical account of his expedition into the uncharted depths of the Brazilian rainforest.
